Add internal state function to core.cljc

Internal state is an atom added to every sketch. It's a handy way to store sketch-specific Quil state both in clj and cljs. Currently such pieces of state are stored on in meta object in Clojure or on processing object in cljs which leads to conditional macros in cljs an makes code harder to read. Internal state helps with. The downside that it's probably slower compared to setting properties on object but speed is not a big concern in the moment. We can optimize it later if needed.

This commit also migrates existing scattered states to the internal state.

:settings has to be used in clojure version for (smooth) and (no-smooth) functions. It's not supported in clojurescript.

Fix (copy) function.

Processing 3 cannot take instance of PGraphics where it expects PImage even though they're in child-parent relationship. So we cannot pass PGraphics as source in (copy) because source must be PImage.

	project.clj
Fix image in README. Add link to wiki.
Release 1.7.0.

Fix NPE on frame closing.

Processing (PApplet) provides a way for third-party libraries (like Quil) to listen to events, e.g. "dispose" event. We use it register our own listener (quil.helper.AppletListener) that later calls "applet-disposed" function which in turn disposes frame and run "on-close" user-provided function.
Fix mouseWheel method. Processing 2.0 supports it natively.
Update PConstants according to processing 2.0. Set size for applet before we run it.

Fix reflection warnings. Fix several bugs.

* Fix (focused) function. Didn't work before.
* Remove (specular gray alpha) and (specular x y z a) functions. They don't exist.
* Remove (text-width ch) function. Now (text-width) only accepts String as parameter. Version which accepts char is broken in 1.5.1, it was broken only very recently: https://github.com/processing/processing/issues/2331
Alphabetize functions.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'rosado/master' into hacking

Clean up applet semantics:

* We now have non-macro #'applet for creating applets
* #'defapplet is now a shim over #'applet
* Removed #'run - applet now starts automatically
* switched from .destroy() to .stop() as the former seems to kill the JVM process?!
* added mouse-moved and mouse-dragged handler support
* consolidated size calls - now #'size in setup is deprecated. The :size key in applet/defapplet now accepts a drawing mode such as OPENGL
* add #'applet-stop, #'applet-start, #'applet-exit and #'applet-close helper fns
* add default :size key to applet/defapplet [500 300]
ignore cake detritus
updated examples to use processing.core, frame-rate, and display-filter

Add a few more docstrings

Provide implementations for keyPress handlers so that clj-processing's behvaviour matches vanilla processing. Now, a :key-press handler doesn't take any args and must call fns such as #'key-code to determine the current key. 

Clobbering the method that receives the event (which previously happened) is discouraged in the documentation:

"Overriding keyXxxxx(KeyEvent e) functions will cause the 'key', 'keyCode', and 'keyEvent' variables to no longer work; key events will no longer be queued until the end of draw(); and the keyPressed(), keyReleased() and keyTyped() methods will no longer be called."
Provide a default :draw fn which does nothing - but allows the looping constructs to work (required for handling keypress events)
Fix save-frame (allowing string file-matcher arg) and add stroke-cap modes for lines. Also add docstrings for both fns
Add the ability to store and retrieve canvas-specific state
